item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Wenis_Tree Wenis Tree
item.description:
@Wenis_Tree wrote:

so this?

[code] public void clearQInterface() {
for(int iD = 29172; iD <= 29264;iD++){
getPA().sendFrame126("", iD);
}
getPA().sendFrame126(“Solitude: “+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+” Online”, 29155); //Tab Title

            getPA().sendFrame126("Owner", 29161); //1st section title
                    getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Solitude", 29162); //1rd section content
            
            getPA().sendFrame126("Website & Forum", 29163); //2nd section title

            getPA().sendFrame126("@lre@Information", 663); //To replace "FREE QUESTS"
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

That id is probably the same as the original 317 interface. Try the id: 663.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Wenis_Tree Wenis Tree
item.description:
@Wenis_Tree wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:6, topic:464895”][quote author=Wenis Tree link=topic=569052.msg4129356#msg4129356 date=1350860525]
I just want to change were it says free quests… the color can stay the same.
[/quote]
Read back over what I said; Each bit of text, every button, every sprite has a unique id. The interface id is the parent id, and all the id’s below it are all children ids. For example:

 getPA().sendFrame126("Owner", 29161); //1st section title

Sends the string “Owner” to the id 29161. Find the id if you want to do it server sided. Or you can try one of the other methods.[/quote]

yeah… heres the website one getPA().sendFrame126("Website & Forum", 29163);
then FREE QUESTS is 2 after it… soo its id will be 29165… but… heres 29165 getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Items Kept on Death", 29165);

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Wenis Tree:

I just want to change were it says free quests… the color can stay the same.

Read back over what I said; Each bit of text, every button, every sprite has a unique id. The interface id is the parent id, and all the id’s below it are all children ids. For example:

 getPA().sendFrame126("Owner", 29161); //1st section title

Sends the string “Owner” to the id 29161. Find the id if you want to do it server sided. Or you can try one of the other methods.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Wenis_Tree Wenis Tree
item.description:
@Wenis_Tree wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:2, topic:464895”]Server side:

[ul][li]If the interface is custom, look in the RSInterface class to get the id of that text[/li]
[li]If it’s standard, use an interface editor or other resource to get the id of that text[/li][/ul]

Client side:

[ul][li]In the RSInterface class, look at the other interfaces for example, and adjust what needs to be.[/li][/ul]

Cache side:

[ul][li]Use an interface editor to change the text, then repack.[/li]
[li]Use a HEX editor to change the text and color.[/li][/ul][/quote]

can you explain that some more? i dont understand.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Server side:

[ul][li]If the interface is custom, look in the RSInterface class to get the id of that text[/li]
[li]If it’s standard, use an interface editor or other resource to get the id of that text[/li][/ul]

Client side:

[ul][li]In the RSInterface class, look at the other interfaces for example, and adjust what needs to be.[/li][/ul]

Cache side:

[ul][li]Use an interface editor to change the text, then repack.[/li]
[li]Use a HEX editor to change the text and color.[/li][/ul]

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Wenis_Tree Wenis Tree
item.description:
@Wenis_Tree wrote:

How do i change were it says “FREE QUESTS” i cant find out how…

Heres my code:

[CODE] public void clearQInterface() {
for(int iD = 29172; iD <= 29264;iD++){
getPA().sendFrame126("", iD);
}
getPA().sendFrame126(“Solitude: “+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+” Online”, 29155); //Tab Title

	getPA().sendFrame126("Owner", 29161); //1st section title
		getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Solitude", 29162); //1rd section content
	
	getPA().sendFrame126("Website & Forum", 29163); //2nd section title
}[/CODE]

Help is appreciated

Read full topic
